recipes.label: The First Forms?
recipes.startdescription: I've brought a sufficient concentration of <sprite name=edge> to bear. With <sprite name=forge> I could assemble the General's own namesake, or, with <sprite name=heart> aspect, fashion its easterly cousin.

recipes.label: The First Forms?
recipes.startdescription:
I might create something here. If I initiated these processes with <sprite name=edge> aspect, enough of a secondary aspect, and some spare flesh, I could shape something predatory. Or, I could tinker with the tiniest bit of <sprite name=moth> and <sprite name=grail> to fashion something much smaller, and much more endearing.

[Any Allies used in this process will be lost.]

recipes.label: A Novice's Construction: Tiger
recipes.startdescription: Heart to invoke the jungle rains and the vibrancy of the eastern forests, where the beast is uncontested. Edge-aspect, to give it strength and ferocity.
recipes.description: The tiger blinks at me. It pads at the ground with its great paws. At last it gives me its approval, nosing my shoulder with its great snout before loping off to find prey. It will return from its hunt when I call upon it in battle.

recipes.label: A Novice's Construction: Lion
recipes.startdescription: Forge to conjure the heat of the deep desert and the arid savannah, and to instill in my creation pride and bravery. And Edge-aspect, of course, for all lions are weapons.
recipes.description: The lion rises from its place and, after a moment, I am permitted to approach. I am permitted, too, to scratch it behind the ears. It yawns, and I see its bone-white teeth, clean and yet to be used in battle. But I will change that.

recipes.label: A Novice's Construction: Cat
recipes.startdescription: I'll be bringing more cats into the world. That can't be a bad thing.
recipes.description: Mewing, mewing! Not a minute in the world and already making demands.

recipes.label: The Greater Forms?
recipes.startdescription: I've brought a significant concentration of <sprite name=edge> to bear. If I apply <sprite name=lantern> aspect, I could fashion a fierce, flying thing; if I alloy my materials with <sprite name=forge> aspect, I could engineer what some call a 'fencing lion'; if I instead sublimated with <sprite name=winter> aspect, I could construct an unusually furtive servant of the Lionsmith.

recipes.label: The Greater Forms?
recipes.startdescription:
Potential hums in the air. I'll need a significant power of <sprite name=edge>, a secondary concentration of another aspect to direct the raw strength towards a purpose, and again, flesh that isn't being used by anyone. I'll also need a foundation to pour power into; an already-living beast will serve that purpose well.

[Any Allies used in this process will be lost.]

recipes.label: A Practitioner's Construction: Labhite
recipes.startdescription: Of all the Lionsmith's creations, labhites know Glory best, for they spend their time in the sky and in the sun. Lantern will glorify these materials, and make them suitable for the proper infusions of Edge. Whatever flesh and life I use in this process will be changed, and irrevocably.
recipes.description: Eagle-eyed and eagle-winged; like the lion, ferocious; like the dragon, incendiary.

recipes.label: A Practitioner's Construction: Spathiurus
recipes.startdescription: Leonine physiology will serve as the most reliable blueprint for the creation of a spathiurus. Edge will arm it and sharpen it; Forge will imbue it with an interior flame and a fierce, biting heat.
recipes.description: The spathiurus unfurls, unsheathes. It drags its sword-tail along the earth, and where the earth is touched, it bubbles and melts. Devilish eyes lock with mine. It is eager.

recipes.label: A Practitioner's Construction: Hesukhine
recipes.startdescription: Hesukhines are closest to tigers in form and lethality. The Edge aspect I have accrued will agitate and excite the composition of its teeth and claws, but Winter will teach it silence, patience, stillness - things usually unheeded by creatures of the Lionsmith.
recipes.description: The hesukhine bristles anxiously. Perhaps it is shy. I keep my distance and throw bits of meat to it. After it has had its fill, it seems to relax, and acknowledges me with the softest mewing of its little voice before vanishing from sight.

recipes.label: The Greatest Forms?
recipes.startdescription: Certain profusions of Grail and Moth can induce useful perversions - or exaltations, as they are called by some - in the flesh of labhites. Other monstrous forms can be reforged with the strength of the earth, with Forge and Heart, to give rise to a skaptodon - or something very much like one.

recipes.label: The Greatest Forms?
recipes.startdescription: This is a monumental power of Edge - but to shape the strongest, the very strongest of the Lionsmith's children with my mortal hands, I will need more.

recipes.label: The Greatest Forms?
recipes.startdescription:
Only a monumental power of Edge can rouse these processes into activation. I must pour that power into monstrous flesh, slain and living both. Only then will conditions permit the emergence of something truly terrible.

[Any Allies used in this process will be lost.]

recipes.label: A Master's Construction: Echidniform
recipes.startdescription: Grail and Moth - birth and change - will allow me to approximate the transformative powers found in Echidna's infamous milks. The labhite will undergo a painful transfiguration once exposed to these agents, and I must regulate the trajectory of that transfiguration with a generous amount of Edge.
recipes.description: The process is slow. Bones snap, joints pop, appendages sprout and recede. It would probably be more comfortable in a cocoon - but the creature, my creation, endures. Finally: the flapping, hissing mess arises from the muck of its making, and roars.

recipes.label: A Master's Construction: Skaptodon
recipes.startdescription: Monsters, like weapons, can be broken; monsters, like weapons, can be reforged. The Edge I have amassed here will be responsible for the breaking; the Forge and Heart will renew a titanic strength from the fragments of what had been.
recipes.description: A skaptodon bears some resemblance to a mole, if a mole bore some resemblance to an armoured tank, to a dragon, to a lion at the height of its strength. Furnace-eyes glow in deep sockets of darkness. Sniffing the air, it senses me, and smiles: its teeth, a row of pale spears.

recipes.label: Rebellion!
recipes.startdescription: My methods are only mortal approximations of Hourly arts. Something going wrong isn't out of the question, especially when dealing with matters as sensitive as loyalty -
recipes.description: Without betrayal, the Lionsmith learned, there would be an end to war. Seems plenty true to me.
